channel.title: Linked Lists :: CIS 308 Textbook
channel.description: We can use structs to help implement all the common data structures in C. For example, whereas before we would have created a Node class to help us write a linked list, we will now create a node struct: struct node { int data; struct node *next; //pointer to next node in list }; Suppose we want to create a linked list with a single node. First, we declare a head variable:
